intro: Neuroplatyceros biformis, commonly known as the two-lobed fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are divided into two lobes, giving it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizome is creeping and produces clustered, short, and often branched fronds. The leaves are usually leathery and have a serrated or toothed margin, contributing to its ornamental value.
